title: Quiz 6: Placenta, Cord & Circulation
description: Understanding placental functions, cord anomalies, and the unique foetal circulation system.

questions.question: Which blood vessel in the umbilical cord carries oxygenated blood and nutrients from the placenta to the foetus?
questions.explanation: The single Umbilical Vein carries oxygenated blood *towards* the foetal heart. Arteries carry waste away.
questions.hint: Veins usually go to the heart; in foetal life, this one has the 'good' blood.

questions.question: Match the foetal circulatory shunt with its function:

pairs.right: Bypasses the lungs (Right Atrium -> Left Atrium)

questions.explanation: Ductus Venosus (Liver bypass); Foramen Ovale (Atrial bypass); Ductus Arteriosus (Lung/Pulmonary bypass).
questions.hint: Ovale is in the heart; Arteriosus connects arteries.

questions.question: Which of the following are functions of the Placenta? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The placenta breathes, feeds, protects, and excretes for the baby, and produces hormones. It does not digest food mechanically.
questions.hint: It acts as lungs, kidneys, and endocrine gland.

questions.question: What is the name of the placental abnormality where the cord is inserted into the membranes, and vessels run through the membranes to the placenta?
questions.explanation: Velamentous insertion is dangerous as vessels can rupture (Vasa Praevia).

questions.question: The umbilical cord normally contains ___BLANK___ arteries and ___BLANK___ vein.
questions.explanation: There are 2 arteries and 1 vein in a normal cord.
questions.hint: Think of a face: 2 eyes (arteries) and 1 mouth (vein).

questions.question: What happens to the Foramen Ovale after birth?

options.text: It closes due to increased pressure in the left atrium

questions.explanation: When the baby breathes, pulmonary flow increases, raising left atrial pressure, which pushes the flap of the Foramen Ovale closed.
questions.hint: It closes due to pressure changes in the heart chambers.

questions.question: What is the term for a small extra lobe of the placenta separated from the main placenta but joined by blood vessels?
questions.explanation: A Succenturiate lobe is an accessory lobe. If retained, it causes hemorrhage.

questions.question: The umbilical arteries carry oxygenated blood to the foetus.
questions.explanation: False. Umbilical Arteries carry DEOXYGENATED blood from the foetus back to the placenta. The Vein carries oxygenated blood.
questions.hint: It is the opposite of adult systemic circulation.
